title: 'I’m not going to do it.' Police aren't eager to help Trump enforce immigration laws
text: "It is my job to investigate crimes," said Hopkins of the Los Angeles Police Department's Wilshire Division, who also serves on the police union's communications committee. "And if I can't do that, I can't get justice for people, because all of a sudden, I'm losing my witnesses or my victims because they're afraid that talking to me is going to lead to them getting deported."
summary:
"It is my job to investigate crimes," said Hopkins of the Los Angeles Police Department's Wilshire Division, who also serves on the police union's communications committee.
"And if I can't do that, I can't get justice for people, because all of a sudden, I'm losing my witnesses or my victims because they're afraid that talking to me is going to lead to them getting deported."
